newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador rules out foreign debt renegotiation.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador rules out foreign debt renegotiation.

text.p: The president of Ecuador's Monetary Board, Danilo Carrera, ruled out Wednesday a renegotiation of the country's foreign debt or a moratorium on payments to its creditors.

"All international commitments will be met with various measures that will be adopted that will be aimed at reducing debt servicing charges. A moratorium or renegotiation of debt are issues that are impossible to do," Carrera told reporters.

The statements came a day after Finance Minister Carlos Davalos suggested in a local newspaper article that the government will raise the issue of a debt renegotiation with the International Monetary Fund in order to reduce interest charges.
The board is a policy-setting institution that works closely with the Finance Ministry.
The servicing of Ecuador's foreign debt, which totals more than $14.5 billion, takes up 45 percent of the country's 1997 budget.
